channel.title: The WordPress Showcase
channel.description: The Best WordPress Sites in the World

item.title: Vogue
item.dc:creator: pmaiorana
item.content:encoded:
Vogue is a globally recognized fashion and lifestyle magazine, published monthly by Cond√© Nast.
Why it's in the Showcase: This is a great example of using a modern web app built with React and the WordPress Rest API.

item.title: Global News
item.dc:creator: rosso99
item.content:encoded: Global News is the news and current affairs division of Global Television Network in Canada, overseeing all local and national news programming on the network's twelve owned-and-operated stations.

item.title: The Pioneer Woman
item.dc:creator: rosso99
item.content:encoded: Ann Marie "Ree" Drummond¬†is an award-winning American blogger, No. 1 New York Times bestselling author,¬†food writer, photographer and television personality who lives on a working ranch outside of Pawhuska, Oklahoma. In February 2010, she was listed as No. 22 on Forbes' Top 25 Web Celebrities‚Äîone of only four women.¬†Her blog, The Pioneer Woman, which documents Drummond's daily life as a ranch wife and mother, was named Weblog of the Year 2009,¬†2010,¬†and 2011¬†at the Annual Weblog Awards (The Bloggies). In 2009 TIME Magazine named Drummond's Confessions of a Pioneer Woman one of the "25 Best Blogs" in the world.

item.title: The City University of New York
item.dc:creator: rosso99
item.content:encoded: The City University of New York (CUNY) is the public university system of New York City, and the largest urban university in the United States.

item.title: Silversun Pickups
item.dc:creator: bridgetwillard
item.content:encoded: Official website of recording artist Silversun Pickups. This site for one of USA‚Äôs leading alternative rock bands, receives high weekly traffic from all over the world and looks great while doing it.

item.title: Rock My Wedding
item.dc:creator: bridgetwillard
item.content:encoded: Rock My Wedding (RMW), part of the Rock My Ltd. group, which includes Rock My Family and Rock My Style, is the UK‚Äôs leading influential brand in the wedding industry. The biggest wedding blog and planning resource in the UK, the Rock My Wedding website attracts 230k readers and has more than 1.3 million followers across social media. The Love Lust List is RMW‚Äôs venue and supplier site, designed to make it even easier for couples to plan their special day.

item.title: Daddys Takoyaki
item.dc:creator: bridgetwillard
item.content:encoded: Daddys Takoyaki is one of the best selling takoyaki franchises in Indonesia, We have gained the trust by the community because our sense takoyaki guaranteed 100% delicious and guaranteed kosher.

item.title: Gulf Coast Adoptions
item.dc:creator: bridgetwillard
item.content:encoded: As adoptive parents ourselves we wanted to find a way to help others through this journey. Both on the birthmother side and the parent‚Äôs side. It is not easy. SO we created a business and website to offer these services.

item.title: Expohouse
item.dc:creator: harryjackson1221
item.content:encoded: Expohouse is a full service partner in trade fair located in Sweden, providing event and interior production for retail and public spaces.

item.title: Unicef UK
item.dc:creator: harryjackson1221
item.content:encoded: Unicef is the world‚Äôs leading organisation working for children in danger. Make a donation, fundraise or campaign ‚Äì help us keep children safe.

item.title: Urban Southern
item.dc:creator: harryjackson1221
item.content:encoded: Urban Southern creates handcrafted, honest leather bags that simply fit your everyday. Made in the southern U.S.A. from full grain, locally tanned saddle leather.

item.title: The White House
item.dc:creator: Otto42
item.content:encoded:
WordPress is trusted by some of the highest-profile sites on the Web.

The White House has been using open source CMSs since 2009, and WordPress since 2018. In 2021, the Biden administration chose to continue using WordPress for their new site.

item.title: Qube Global Software
item.dc:creator: bridgetwillard
item.content:encoded: Read the¬†WordPress Case Study, submitted by Moove Agency, a WordPress web design agency & WordPress company from London. This site was built with WordPress and resulted in a fantastic ongoing relationship between Moove Agency and its client, Qube Global Software. WordPress, WordPress Multisite, and its available plugins made it possible to create several awesome sites from one master theme. Choosing these tools was key in a successful and sustainable project, enabling teams to easily maintain their own websites.

item.title: Lawson Bates
item.dc:creator: bridgetwillard
item.content:encoded:
Country Music artist website for Lawson Bates. Lawson released his first full country album in fall 2016; which featured some of Nashville‚Äôs top artists and musicians. He wrote and co-wrote eight of the twelve songs on the album. Lawson also stars with his parents and 18 siblings in the hit reality television series Bringing Up Bates.
The design and showing how versatile WordPress truly can be.

item.title: Network Rail
item.dc:creator: bridgetwillard
item.content:encoded:
Network Rail owns and operates the entire railway infrastructure in the United Kingdom, managing 18 of the largest stations in England, Scotland and Wales. Network Rail delivers 4.5 million journeys a day for its customers, managing rail timetabling by working with several different partners across the UK.
This project took place during the biggest upgrade of the network in 150 years and it‚Äôs aim was to similarly upgrade the website to make it easier for users to find the service they are looking for.
The new theme that was developed greatly improved the UX of the site and the various custom user roles make it much easier for Network Rail to manage them internally. The new design layout is also far easier for users to navigate and the site is now responsive across all mobile devices.

item.title: Gab Now
item.dc:creator: bridgetwillard
item.content:encoded:
A non-profit anti-bullying website designed by Dean Voss, Wildstylez Website Design Studio.
The modern, upscale design puts a positive spin on the bullying epidemic by offering events, services and programs for children, teens, adults and schools.

item.title: Capgemini
item.dc:creator: bridgetwillard
item.content:encoded:
Moving from Drupal 7 to WordPress made sense for a business user like Capgemini, freeing up much of the technical overhead and complexity surrounding content publishing and more. Human Made helped Capgemini enable a new digital culture of creation with a robust, usable, and intuitive CMS to support them in delivering their business objectives and empowering their global network of teams to do their jobs effectively.
By the end of the project, a large portion of the Capgemini network had been moved from Drupal to WordPress, undergoing a complex migration of 38 sites and content syndication across their local and main sites, as well as rebuilding their entire platform architecture.

item.title: Daybreaker
item.dc:creator: bridgetwillard
item.content:encoded: Daybreaker is a global dance movement in 25 cities around the world and growing. The site brings people together. It is building a global dance tribe and the site looks beautiful!

item.title: Rolling Stone
item.dc:creator: harryjackson1221
item.content:encoded: Rolling Stone is an American monthly magazine that focuses on popular culture. Why it's in the Showcase: It was recently highlighted in a case study published by the Make.WordPress.org Marketing team.

item.title: Hodge Bank
item.dc:creator: harryjackson1221
item.content:encoded:
Hodge Bank is a well-established UK savings and commercial lending bank, who run a number of websites on WordPress. The main bank website, produced by Illustrate Digital, is a security-conscious tool to help customers explore financial products and provide access to view and manage their savings accounts.

The brand selected WordPress for its flexibility and scalability. It benefits from a block approach to allow the internal marketing team to create and edit content freely across the range of Hodge websites.

item.title: Ladybird Education
item.dc:creator: harryjackson1221
item.content:encoded:
The Ladybird Education site, produced by Illustrate Digital, is an international resource of teaching materials to help school children learn English. The large library of Ladybird books can each be unlocked to access more teaching resources and eBook versions of each publication.

The site runs entirely in WordPress and is integrated with AWS to deliver its resources, alongside an integration with Auth0 to issue secure user authentication.

item.title: Marginal Revolution
item.dc:creator: harishanker
item.content:encoded:
Marginal Revolution is the blog of Tyler Cowen and Alex Tabarrok, both of whom teach at George Mason University. In numerous reviews and ratings over the years Marginal Revolution has consistently been ranked as the best or one of the best economic blogs on the web, but it is more (and less) than that, also representing the quirks of its authors.

Why it's in the showcase?

Tyler and Alex (the founders) unleashed the power of WordPress to grow their project from a blog to a rich community of folks finding connectivity through the language of economics. The community has been able to leverage WordPress to evolve into a learning site that houses the largest online library of free economics education videos (over 900!).

item.title: Tonal
item.dc:creator: harishanker
item.content:encoded:
Tonal is an online service that has offers home-based personal health solutions. The service offers fitness coaches and artificial intelligence-based solutions for people to get a superior workout from their homes without having to visit a gym. Tonal is essentially an eCommerce platform built using WordPress.

Why is it in the showcase?

The Tonal site has a very quirky and attractive design and UX. The service itself is quite popular and successful. Tonal has raised $110 million and has seen its sales increase 12 times in 12 months.

item.title: Childrens Radio Foundation
item.dc:creator: harishanker
item.content:encoded:
The Children's Radio Foundation is an initiative to give young people the tools and skills to express their ideas and share their stories, thereby giving them access to a world of wider opportunities. Since its founding by Elizabeth Sachs in 2006, the organization has created a network of more than 1700 trained youth radio reporters across six countries in Africa, who broadcast on local and national radio stations and via social media.

Why is it in the showcase?

The organization has an attractive website with great UX. It was able to do a lot of ground-level work during the COVID-19 pandemic thanks to its WordPress-powered site.
